item.title: Changing thieving stalls
item.dc:creator: @TimmahPwnz TimmahPwnz
item.description:
@TimmahPwnz wrote:

Ill Give You A Better Example, If You Have TeamViewer I Might Be Able To Help Easyier, Send Me Your ID + Pass In A Pm.

Okay First Look For
" deletethatobject "
Ther Should Be Something Like " deletethatobject(x-axis, y-axis);

Make As Many Of Them As You Need To Cover The WHOLE Object.

After That’s Competed, Find " MakeGlobalObject "
There Should Be Something Like " MakeGlobalObject(x-axis, y-axis, ObjectID, -2, 10); "
Ill Explain, You Get x-axis, y-axis, ObjectID, But -2, Thats What Direction Its Facing( 1, 2, -1, -2)
And Just Leave 10 As What It Is, Also, To Stop Getting Confused, Put A // “Description” At The End Of, The Codes
deletethatobject(x-axis, y-axis); // Old Stall At Edge
MakeGlobalObject(x-axis, y-axis, ObjectID, -2, 10); // New Stall At Lumby[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 28, 2009, 09:14:53 pm[/size][hr][quote=“TimmahPwnz”]Ill Give You A Better Example, If You Have TeamViewer I Might Be Able To Help Easyier, Send Me Your ID + Pass In A Pm.

Okay First Look For
" deletethatobject "
Ther Should Be Something Like " deletethatobject(x-axis, y-axis);

Make As Many Of Them As You Need To Cover The WHOLE Object.

After That’s Competed, Find " MakeGlobalObject "
There Should Be Something Like " MakeGlobalObject(x-axis, y-axis, ObjectID, -2, 10); "
Ill Explain, You Get x-axis, y-axis, ObjectID, But -2, Thats What Direction Its Facing( 1, 2, -1, -2)
And Just Leave 10 As What It Is, Also, To Stop Getting Confused, Put A // “Description” At The End Of, The Codes
deletethatobject(x-axis, y-axis); // Old Stall At Edge
MakeGlobalObject(x-axis, y-axis, ObjectID, -2, 10); // New Stall At Lumby[/quote]

And Yes, It Is In Client.java, And Remember, Compile After EVERYTHING, Except CFG Files

Read full topic

client.java
look for the id of the thieiving stalls and the current coords . and change them once u found em.
